author: Doug Bostrom
content:
It’s hard to picture a ship carrying passengers without the immediate services of a crew for the case of an emergency automation can’t handle. Maybe passengers would follow a disembodied voice in an evacuation situation? Who wants to be first to find out?

Given that the realm of acceptable, plausible possibility says a crew will be present along with passengers, I suppose the crew’s training could be attenuated to only serving drinks and lifejackets.

But perhaps some stick and rudder skills might be good, if only vestigially?
